meanings.definition: To report or describe (an offense or wrongdoing)
meanings.sent1: She delated the incident to the teacher immediately.
meanings.sent2: The witness delated the crime to the police.
meanings.sent3: He delated the missing cookie jar incident with a serious tone.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor delated the breaking news with urgency.
meanings.sent5: The child delated the playground bully's actions to the principal.

meanings.sent1: They delated the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: The decision to delate the project deadline was made by the manager.
meanings.sent3: The student delated studying for the exam until the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The rain delated our outdoor plans for the day.
meanings.sent5: The repair work was delated due to unforeseen circumstances.

meanings.sent1: Social media platforms are used to delate news quickly.
meanings.sent2: The organization delated the event details to all members.
meanings.sent3: She delated the gossip about the new student around the school.
meanings.sent4: The virus delated rapidly throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The flyer delated information about the upcoming concert.
